data.title: Manisha Koirala: After 30 years, 100 films, I have earned my me time
data.meta_description: She will next be seen in Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Heera Mandi
data.text:
The acclaimed actress shared that after having a career spanning over three decades. And 100 films, she has “earned” her “me time”.

Manisha took to Instagram, where she shared a slew of pictures, which she captioned: “A lot of people ask me what I'm doing these days...some genuinely asking but sometimes it's like asking at 53 you couldn't be doing much...true !!”

She added: “But happy too for I'm tasting different flavours of life, doing only those things I love and that means, at times doing absolutely nothing and relaxing with my cats and dogs or with books, music and perusing spiritual learnings, learning to sing and dance, walk in the nature, gymming, globe-trotting..”

“After 30 years and 100 films I think I have earned my me time...l work when I know I would love the process of work!!”

Also Read: Rajkumar Rao pens b'day note for 'love' Patralekha: You complete me

Manisha said: “I soak in their love and care...having lived alone most of my life in a buzzing city with the most demanding profession that I adore yet filled with uncertainty not to forget being a celebrity, one has to face too many ups and downs, good and bad people...good media and harmful fake news...without security of supportive circle of people and all alone !!”

“I guess being younger one had the zeal to take the world head-on...besides I think in your most loneliest times god sends angels and I had very handful of true friends !!! My memories are timeless treasures of my heart... like life, good and bad, happy and sad…”

Manisha concluded: “You see now I prefer much quieter, slower, fewer shocks, less drama, no more impulsive decisions but a thorough thought out long term thing... co-creating peaceful, happy, healthy wholesome life !!”

Also Read: Babita Phogat visits Suhani Bhatnagar’s home to pay tribute to the late artiste

Manisha stepped into the world of acting with the Nepali film Pheri Bhetaula in 1989. It was in 1991 when she featured in the Hindi film Saudagar. She has starred in several acclaimed movies such as 1942: A Love Story, Bombay, Indian, Gupt: The Hidden Truth, Khamoshi: The Musical, Dil Se.., Kachche Dhaage and Ek Chhotisi Love Story, among many others.

On the work front, she will next be seen in Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Heera Mandi, which tells the tales of the lives of tawaifs in the red-light district of Heera Mandi in Lahore, based during the Indian Independence movement against the British Raj.
